data.enText: to form or make sth form into a curl or curls
His hair curls naturally.
to form or make sth form into a curved shape

data.chText: 那只猫蜷缩成一团睡着了。
data.enText: The cat curled into a ball and went to sleep.
She curled her legs up under her.

data.chText: （使）呈螺旋（或卷曲）状移动；（使）旋绕；缭绕
data.enText: to move while forming into a twisted or curved shape; to make sth do this
The smoke curled steadily upwards.

data.chText: 他转身把球一盘，绕过了守门员。
data.enText: He turned and curled the ball around the goalkeeper.
if you curl your lip or your lip curls , you move your lip upwards and sideways to show that you think sb/sth is stupid or that you are better than they are
curl up
be curled up
to lie or sit with your back curved and your arms and legs bent close to your body

data.chText: 她蜷成一团，闭上了眼睛。
data.enText: She curled up and closed her eyes.
curl up
curl sb up
to become or make sb become very embarrassed
curl up
curl sth↔up
to form or make sth form into a tightly curled shape

data.chText: 那张纸在高温下开始起皱卷曲。
data.enText: The paper started to shrivel and curl up in the heat.
a small bunch of hair that forms a curved or round shape
Her hair was a mass of curls.

data.chText: 那婴孩长着深色的眼睛和深色的鬈发。
data.enText: The baby had dark eyes and dark curls.
the tendency of hair to form curls
His hair had a natural curl.
a thing that forms a curved or round shape
a curl of smoke

data.chText: 用圈状巧克力来装饰这个蛋糕。
data.enText: Decorate the cake with curls of chocolate.
a contemptuous curl of the lip (= an expression showing disapproval)
make sb's toes curl
to make sb feel embarrassed or uncomfortable
curl up
be curled up
to lie or sit with your back curved and your arms and legs bent close to your body

data.chText: 她蜷成一团，闭上了眼睛。
data.enText: She curled up and closed her eyes.
curl up
curl sb up
to become or make sb become very embarrassed
curl up
curl sth↔up
to form or make sth form into a tightly curled shape

data.chText: 那张纸在高温下开始起皱卷曲。
data.enText: The paper started to shrivel and curl up in the heat.

tr: a strand or cluster of hair
a round shape formed by a series of concentric circles (as formed by leaves or flower petals)
form a curl, curve, or kink
example: the cigar smoke curled up at the ceiling

tr: play the Scottish game of curling
twist or roll into coils or ringlets
wind around something in coils or loops
shape one's body into a curl
example: She curled farther down under the covers

value.def: If you have curls, your hair is in the form of tight curves and spirals.

example.ex: ...the little girl with blonde curls...
example.tran: 长着金色卷发的小女孩

example.ex: A curl of black hair fell loosely across his forehead.
example.tran: 他的额头上垂着一绺散开的黑色卷发。

value.def: If your hair has curl, it is full of curls.

example.ex: Dry curly hair naturally for maximum curl and shine.
example.tran: 让卷发自然变干，才能使头发卷最多，最有光泽。

value.def: If your hair curls or if you curl it, it is full of curls.

example.ex: She has hair that refuses to curl...
example.tran: 她头发不易出卷。

example.ex: Maria had curled her hair for the event...
example.tran: 玛丽亚为出席那次活动烫了头发。

example.ex: Afro hair is short and tightly curled.
example.tran: 非洲式发型是浓密的小短卷。

value.def: A curl of something is a piece or quantity of it that is curved or spiral in shape.

example.ex: A thin curl of smoke rose from a rusty stove.
example.tran: 生锈的炉子里冒出一缕青烟。

example.ex: ...curls of lemon peel.
example.tran: 螺旋状的柠檬皮

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N <l>of</l> n

value.def: If your toes, fingers, or other parts of your body curl, or if you curl them, they form a curved or round shape.

example.ex: His fingers curled gently round her wrist...
example.tran: 他轻轻地握住她的手腕。

example.ex: Raise one foot, curl the toes and point the foot downwards...
example.tran: 抬起一只脚，弯曲脚趾，使脚尖朝下。

example.ex: She sat with her legs curled under her.
example.tran: 她盘腿坐着。

value.def: If something curls somewhere, or if you curl it there, it moves there in a spiral or curve.

example.ex: Smoke was curling up the chimney...
example.tran: 烟从烟囱里袅袅升起。

example.ex: He curled the ball into the net.
example.tran: 他一脚弧线球射门成功。

value.tran: (使)呈螺旋(或卷曲)状移动;(使)旋绕

value.def: If a person or animal curls into a ball, they move into a position in which their body makes a rounded shape.

example.ex: He wanted to curl into a tiny ball...
example.tran: 他想蜷缩成小小的一团。

example.ex: The kitten was curled on a cushion on the sofa.
example.tran: 那只小猫在沙发垫子上蜷缩成了一团。

example.ex: In colder weather, your cat will curl up into a tight, heat-conserving ball...
example.tran: 天气更冷时，猫会为了保存热量而紧紧地缩成一团。

example.ex: She curled up next to him...
example.tran: 她蜷缩在他身边。

example.ex: He was asleep there, curled up in the fetal position.
example.tran: 他像胎儿一样蜷曲地睡在那儿。

value.def: When a leaf, a piece of paper, or another flat object curls, its edges bend towards the centre.

example.ex: The rose leaves have curled because of an attack by grubs.
example.tran: 玫瑰的叶子因为闹虫害而卷边了。

example.ex: The corners of  the lino were curling up.
example.tran: 油地毡卷角了。

value.def: If you curl your lip, you raise your upper lip slightly at one side, as a way of showing anger or contempt.

example.ex: He curled his upper lip in a show of scepticism...
example.tran: 他撇嘴表示怀疑。

example.ex: She had a small, mean mouth that curled disapprovingly each time her husband wrote something in his diary.
example.tran: 每次丈夫写日记时，她都会不满地撇撇那张刻薄的小嘴。

trans: 蜷缩起来；蜷缩；（叶子、纸等）卷边
